page.title: 01Dulverton and its environs
page.content: Our D Block is mostly made up of undulating countryside with deep valleys and wooded hillsides,and hundreds of fields of grass. Dulverton nestles in one of these quiet valleys with steep wooded slopes all around.It is a friendly little town of about 1300 people and provides for the needs of local people and tourists. Tourists flock to this area,as it is set within the National Park of Exmoor.They come for the beauty and peacefullness of the area,and also for hunting,fishing,shooting and walking. The River Barle passes through the town.It is a small,fast flowing river with rocks and deep pools where trout are to be seen.
